One is that when you add items in your basket, you can't designate a different meal time for each item and log them all at the same time. You have to do breakfast foods together and then lunch, etc. They all log as one meal time. What's the point of even putting them in a basket then?  It should just log straight to whatever meal you choose. The second flaw is that when you click on an item, it automatically puts it in your basket. I want to see the details of the item first before I put it in the basket but it just puts it in there when you click on it to see if it's the one you want to choose.
response: Thank you for providing this great feedback! Currently, you can only log to one meal time at once. The purpose of the Basket is to give you the opportunity to review your foods and finalize details such as quantity, measure, etc. before adding to your log. You can also group foods in your Basket into one recipe before logging.

title: Just what I was looking for
body: I've been trying to find a calorie tracking app that is easier than what I used to use, MyFitnessPal. This is definitely the app for me.
response: We appreciate your thoughtful feedback! We're so happy to hear how much faster Freeform has made it for you to update your daily food log! We are sharing your feedback regarding recipes with the rest of the team. In the meantime, here's a quick tip: if you have previously logged a recipe, you should be able to quickly find that recipe by using the main search bar at the top of your Dashboard, under the 'History' category. Email us at support@nutritionix.com if you additional questions on this in the meantime. Thanks again for your time and comments!

title: LOVE!!! Syncs with Fitbit and is easiest app
body: I love love love this app. I tried them all for a day and then picked the easiest and most accurate. I did not like the the tracker with fitbit but this syncs so you can still see your food score when you open your app. SCORE!

title: This is the food tracking app I‚Äôve been waiting for!
body: As a long time user of MyFitnessPal, I have to say I finally found a food tracking app to replace it! Logging foods using their natural language technology is a breeze. Last night I went out for Korean food, typed ‚ÄúBibimbap‚Äù into the app, and BOOM it was on my food log. No more scrolling through tons of entries to find the food I am trying to log. But for those that prefer to log very specific brands, this app lets you do that too - it has Nutritionix‚Äôs entire database of grocery store products and restaurant foods. This one is a keeper!

title: I Love This App!
body: I discovered this app in mid-August and with its help, I have already lost 5.5 pounds.  Logging your food intake is a tried and true method of losing weight, and this app makes food logging easy and actually kind of fun!  It displays a running total of the calories you have consumed as well as those remaining for the day, along with a tally of carbs, protein, and fat consumed.  Logging can be done either online or via the web app.  This app helps to keep you honest about how much you are eating each day.  Even after I reach my goal, I intend to keep using it to stay at my goal weight.

title: Love the recipe feature!
body: I've used food and fitness trackers before, but I've never used one this good. I love the flexibility in entering foods, including the barcode reader. The recipe feature is outstanding. I can list the foods in the recipe and the amounts, and the number of servings, and it does all the work. I've recently switched to a low carb, high fat, normal protein diet (ketogenic diet) and the daily summary really helps me see how I can balance these macronutrients in my end of the day meal.

title: Very user-friendly while being packed with usability
body: This is so easy to use and quick too. I am using it to target a ketogenic diet; where my daily carbohydrates are less than 10%. This app logs the nutrition data from any food you add times the quantity.  They have a library of thousands of name brand or generic foods. So at the end of the day, it gives you a total nutrition summary which is perfect for counting calories, carbs, etc. I adjusted the daily amount of calories to increase it above 2,000 so it doesn't tell me I'm over the limit because I'm trying to gain weight.

title: This App is Awesome!!!  Better than Weight Watchers
body: I highly recommend this App for anyone who wants to eat better and feel better.  I've found that I keep myself in check with what I'm eating.  It's so easy to track your intake.  It also has a daily summary that actually turns your whole day into one Nutrition Label, and it  breaks down into a pie chart your carbs, protein, etc.  They put a lot of thought into making this App, and it's got so much information on tons of different foods.  I haven't eaten one thing that I wasn't able to find in this App.  Amazing!!!

title: Great for nursing mom
body: I got this for my skinny new mom daughter, to help her be sure she eats enough to be able to breastfeed her baby. I started tracking for her to see how easy it would be for her to use, and it's working out great! Scanning UPC codes is so helpful. The recipe feature is great, too, for foods she eats regularly, and it works either for a single-serving recipe or multiple-serving one and she can then designate how many servings she eats (worked great for a batch of special cookies). It would be nice to select whether one is trying to gain or lose weight, but for her, she just knows that red is good and green is bad.

title: The Best
body: I started this when my Dr. put me on a special diet.  I was not overweight but could afford to lose a few pounds.  With the diet, I needed to be sure I got enough calories.  It worked perfectly.  I have lost 20 pounds and have now been able to try getting even more calories in.  It is so important for me to eat well.

title: Great resource
body: This app is fantastic.  I am using to track quality of calories, not necessarily number of calories, because I'm pregnant.

title: Best food log app
body: I never write reviews, but love this app so much I decided I have to. I've used many food/calorie logging apps, and this is by far my favorite. I have yet to find a food it doesn't have in the database, it's easy to add full meals and recipes, you can speak to it instead of type (if you want), it's easy to see total nutrition or macro breakdown for the day, a meal or a single food, etc. Tracking food can be such a pain, this really makes it easier. Only request is to allow us to set macro goals (in addition to calorie goals). Thanks!
response: Thank you for your feedback, Gretchen! We are thrilled to hear you are enjoying Track. Good news! Our new Macro Goals feature will be released to the mobile app later this summer! Please feel free to email us at support@nutritionix.com for updates on this feature release. In the meantime, you can use this tool on our web app:

title: I hate it
body: Like there wasn't a glut of food logging apps out there already, Nutritionix took their existing app‚Äîthat functioned beautifully, btw‚Äîand turned it into yet another silly girlish diary. "Oh, I gained another quarter-pound; I simply MUST get control of myself! I know... I'll start making a note of every bite that I eat; that will surely curb my wolffish appetite and help me stay at my dainty 84-lb. skeletal figure!"
response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review! We will take your feedback regarding a simple lookup function to our engineering team for review. In the meantime, you can search for nutritional values of your foods right on our website, at nutritionix.com. Thank you!

title: Comprehensive database and easy tracking
body: Hugely impressed with the size of the nutrition database in this app. It had everything I entered, and tons of restaurants too. The smart 'quick add' feature was able to automatically interpret what I wrote and display it as individual items with nutrition information laid out (note: it helps if you add a serving size like "2 eggs" or "1 tbsp whipped cream" otherwise it will just select the most common one for you). Very cool! Will definitely keep using this to track meals.

title: Finally a perfect tracker!
body: Finally, in 2016 we now have the perfect tracker.

title: A food relationship counselor
body: This app is really good at helping me track my food and keeping me on the path of Atkins induction phase. I like the nutrition label it can calculate for your daily intake and I do the math to figure out net carbs. The support team is very responsive to suggestion. If you are looking for an easy way to track  your eating, this is it. Be faithful, log everything, and then you can see an honest picture of your relationship with food and make changes to reclaim a healthy balance with food.

title: Simple and fun to use
body: I've been using this app for a couple weeks and I love how simple it is to understand . The barcode scanner is also a really fun and helpful feature to use. Right now the app only gives recommended daily calorie limits for maintaining current weight and for losing a pound a week but I would like to see an option for gaining weight. I use this app to make sure I'm eating enough throughout the day and I think that an option to set a goal for minimum amount of calories would be helpful.

title: Exactly what I was looking for!
body: I don't usually write reviews, but this App deserves one.  I'm trying to have my child gain weight, and I need to track her calorie intake.  It's very user friendly, it allows you to adjust serving sizes based on how much was eaten.  You can scan items from your refrigerator and it logs them in directly.  One of the best parts, is that I didn't need to sign up and enter a whole lot of useless information.  I needed an App to strictly count calories.  And this one does it perfectly.  Great job!

title: Almost Perfect
body: This app is exactly what I've been looking for. Accurate data, easy tracking, great interface, online sync. And it's not even to version 1.0 yet!

title: Incredible free app
body: *This would be a great app, even with adds or as a paid app.

title: Perfect For me!
body: This app is exactly what I was looking for!  It's so easy to use.  Almost every item I scan is in their system and if not, it gives you the option to add it yourself.  I love that you can see your daily average intake in a pie diagram, as well as percentage. A couple of things would be nice. I'd like to see a weekly average of where I'm at with carbs, carbs broken down (if that's possible), protein, fat, and sodium.  Sodium intake is so important. But, just the way this app stands, it beats all the others I've tried.  :)

title: Needs one more feature for 5 stars!
body: I use this app to keep track of my protein intake since I'm underweight according to some people. This works much better than others I have tried and I like how you can enter your own meals. However, the one thing I think is missing and would really help to make this the best is to have the ability to enter the barcode number instead of having to take a photo if you choose. If that was a feature then without a doubt it would get 5 stars. I doubt developers read these though :)

title: The Best!
body: I've been an avid user of food trackers and have had a lot of success when I use them consistently. The ease and accuracy of this app has been the best so far. I've tried using MFP, which was decent until they started cramming the home feed with ads. Also have tried and used on/off Noom Coach, MyNetDiary, Fat Secret, the Fitbit app, etc. Thank you to the developers for this app. I plan on sticking with this for a very long time. Please do us early testers the favor of grandfathering us in when you need to start charging a fee üòä

title: Not detailed oriented
body: The calorie information is vague.  For example, if you type in Chobani, it defaults to the suspected vanilla or plain calorie information.  I couldn't find the flavored versions of yogurt, which are slightly higher in calories.  I also want to see the full nutrition breakdown, like My Fitness Pal has, not just calories.  It is a watered down version of that.  I was a bit disappointed since it was developed by dietitians.  I thought it would be more detailed with nutrition information, not less detailed than My Fitness Pal.

title: Exercise Logging Problem
body: After having used this app for the past two weeks, I'm loving it so far - I only have one problem with it. When I log exercise, it doesn't subtract from my calorie count for the day or do anything to change my daily calorie allowance. I've had at least two days where I exercised enough to keep myself below my calorie goal for the day, but because the exercise isn't being recognized, my day was red instead. I hope this can get fixed soon!

title: Question
body: Does anyone else have a constant problem with the app not connecting to the Internet even though my Wi-Fi and cellular data are working for everything else? Every time I try to go track something it says you cannot do this until you are connected to the Internet but I am conneced to the Internet. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling I tried to turn my phone off and back on, I just don't know what to do? I don't know if it's my phone or if anybody else has problems with it?

title: Excellent for tracking what you eat
body: After open heart surgery, I've been put on a low fat, low salt, low cholesterol & high fiber diet. This app is terrific. Not only does it have nutritional values for many specific foods and you can change the quantity eaten, it also lets you enter custom recipes.  It of course keeps track of calories as well.  Tried several other apps before finding this one. For my purpose, this is by far the best. Great tracker!

title: A great nutritional study aid
body: I didn't know where to start when it came down to what habits I needed to change to get the results I wanted. This app was a HUGE help learning what my needs were in relation to my goals, and it adjusts with me based on my progress. I didn't plan to keep it on my phone for long because every other tracking app lost my interest after a couple of weeks, but I'm planning to keep this app around for a very long time.

title: Love!
body: This is by far my favorite calorie/carb tracker. I have to track carbs/sugar to keep inflammation low and joint pain away.

title: Solid app. Very helpful
body: Many thanks to the developers. I discovered this app by chance and have used it for a week. Sure, there are little improvements I'd like (weekly total calorie count/deficit or ability to copy entire categories like copy all am snake items from previous day). I will continue to use and enjoy this app. Easy to use and definitely provides me with value.
response: We're thrilled to hear about your experience with Track and that you're finding the app to be a super helpful tool! To copy a whole meal category, just swipe left on the header to reveal quick 'Copy' and 'Delete' buttons. Thank you for your suggestions, and keep the feedback coming at support@nutritionix.com.

title: Best Nutrition Logger
body: I've tried to log my calories and macros by hand and always struggled to keep up with them. This app is incredibly user friendly, has a great library of foods you can add in seconds, and gives an awesome visual of your daily calorie breakdown. Plus, the Alexa skill makes it even easier to log your foods if you have an Echo. Honestly, I would pay put to $10 for this app; it's a steal for a free app.

title: Works so easily!
body: This makes planning your day super easy. So many times I am able to input what I think I want and I am able to cut it down to what I need and what I don't. This is a really easy app to use and it has a huge database of info on ingredients, recipes, and restaurant nutrition information. Very intuitive and user friendly. I love it and it should make it much easier to know exactly what I'm eating and stay healthy.

title: Exactly what I needed
body: This app is exactly what I needed to manage my diet. I have diabetes and cancer and it's become critical for me to manage what I eat. This app is very user friendly so I'm more likely to keep up with my entries. I can review a food before consuming it to see if it will put me over in a given area. I can plan out my exact meals for the day to ensure daily success and good decision making. I like that it is not overly focused on weight loss as my goal is good nutrition.

title: Clunky and primitive
body: A blast from the past, obviously the developers don't use this antiquated piece of software themselves. They have managed to produce an app devoid of features yet confusing and clunky to use. It's not even a streamlined version... It's just devolved. I guess I'm spoiled by the many apps out there that have great, modern features and slick intuitive interfaces. However if you want to use Alexa for food tracking, this is the garbage you are stuck with. For now. My only hope is that MyFitnessPal or WeightWatchers will hurry up and get on the Alexa wagon.

title: Great App
body: I like this food tracker much better than myfitnesspal.  It has every option/restaurant /fast food option you can think of and its easy to add home recipes. There is no option - that I have seen, to track excercise, but that's not my main concern. I have a pretty regimented routine so exercise not an issue, but the food tracking is where I get into trouble.  No longer!!! Love this app!

title: Amazing. Thank You!
body: This is the ONLY app that's truly free! I love the natural track feature. Even though it doesn't have exercise tracking, the app is 5/5 because of how efficient it is. I can't wait until it can finally connect to "Apple Health Kit"

title: Best Calorie App by Far
body: This is the best. I've used looseit and myfitnesspal interchangeably for years. Both incessantly pestered me to pay to upgrade and were really nothing special to begin with.

title: Nutritionix is excellent!!
body: If you want to make data based decisions and you are goal minded, Nutritionix is a great tool to help you. This app has a solid listing of food and nutrition values to pick from on your daily calories. You can add in your personal exercise and see how much difference that makes in your calorie count. It uses your weight to recommend a caloric goal for weight loss and for maintenance. I really like it!

title: Great App with Great Support
body: As anyone knows, counting calories is no fun but this app makes it easy. They have a large library of foods to include preloaded restaurant menus which makes it quick and easy to log your foods.

title: Nutritionix
body: I absolutely love this app! I am on the Medifast diet and Nutritionix is the only app I found to have the Medifast/Optavia foods in their database, it has a restaurant or grocery database as well as a "my recipes" entries. I couldn't find an answer to a question in the FAQs so I emailed Nutritionix and received an answer and resolution to my question within an hour. It was a very friendly response. Highly recommend Nutritionix!

title: Was loving this app...
body: ..until it stopped working. Have been using it for about a week now and thought it was fantastic. Great database of food, with an exceptional abundance of ways to customize your info, goals and manually entered foods.
response: We're excited to hear that you have been enjoying the app! We want to make sure you can continue to take full advantage of all of Track's features, so can you email our team at support@nutritionix.com and include a screenshot of the screen you are stuck on? Thank you!

title: Fantastic calorie counting app, and free too!
body: Love the online integration where you can track from the computer too. Huge range of items to search for, and easy quick type feature.

title: A REAL EYE OPENING APP!
body: This is very easy and convenient to use.  I enjoy being able to see exactly what I am eating in terms of proteins, fats, and carbs as well as total calories.  I know some comments have said it's "basic" but I find it to be well thought out and it's easy so I use it.  Sometimes more complicated isn't necessarily better.  This is perfect for me.  A painless way to get my intake in check.

title: Really is 60 seconds for the day!
body: I've been using myfitnesspal. You MUST try this smart feature, where you just type in what you ate and the app figures it all out and enters it. It's so easy! Their numbers are accurate, you don't have random users entering wrong information. Also! They have nutrition info for TONS of restaurants! Seriously, try this app, it's awesome!

title: DO NOT USE THIS APP
body: This WAS a great app to track you calorie consumption, but the recent update deleted many useful features. Gone is the ability to look up a restaurant or fast-food joints, see what's on their menu and get the calorie count. Gone is a growing history of the foods you have consumed which allowed you to quickly select again. Gone is the ability to look up calorie count of items while you shop. Gone is the ability to log a complete meal. In other words, some of the useful features were removed making this APP useless.

title: Great!
body: I love this app, it's very user friendly. I like the simplicity, my time is valuable and I don't want to spend it figuring out a complicated app, or counting calories for that matter. I tried a few others and they asked too many questions in the beginning, this one I just downloaded and went about my calorie counting.

title: Tracking is EZ and Exciting
body: I Absolutely LOVE this app!!!

title: Wow, everything I need
body: There are tons of apps out there and I feel lucky to have gotten it right on the first try with this app.  Easy, easy, easy, to use.  They are updating the food lists all the time. I tried to enter a jalape√±o yogurt dip but it wasn't in the system.  Next day I got an email saying they added it to the food list.  Blew my mind.   Nice app.

title: Amazing App (improvement suggestions)
body: This is a really good app that keeps me on track for my daily calorie consumption :)

title: Worked 1st Day then....turded out.
body: This was promising the 1st day. I signed up, logged all my info into the app n all was well. Wake up today n ....nothing. My account doesn't even show up. All in all, a waste of time. Deleting n going back to the old app. Good luck with future updates since this needs help now.
response: Thank you for reaching out! When opening the Track app, the app will open by default to your log for the current day. So if your day is just starting, the app will open to a blank log - just waiting for you to add that day's foods! You can use the arrows below the calorie bar to navigate to previous days' logs. Are you have trouble seeing data for previous dates? In this case, don't hesitate to send further details to our team at support@nutritionix.com so that we can get you back on Track. Thanks!

title: Love this app!
body: I first got myfitnesspal to try to track the calories I burned and ate, but it had ads and kept wanting me to upgrade to pro. I tried this app instead and I love it! I can search for all different types of food, it keeps track of my weight and goals, and I can put in my steps and it shows me how many calories I have burned!

title: So convenient
body: This app is so easy to use, especially since you can scan the barcode on products or add your own recipes. The only extra that would be helpful is if you could add a recipe from the web by entering a link rather than typing in all the individual ingredients manually, but that's just me being lazy
response: Thank you for this awesome feedback! Don't hesitate to use our web app (https://www.nutritionix.com/dashboard) for adding recipes and custom foods to your Track account! While you cannot currently enter a URL, you can easily just copy+paste an entire recipe list into the ingredients box, and Track will do the rest of the work for you! If you have further questions about recipe building with Track, send us a quick note at support@nutritionix.com!

title: Exactly What I Was Looking For!
body: I really like this app! I set out to find a simple calorie tracker and this is the app to get! This app contains popular foods from all brands and can even estimate the calories from your family recipes! I also really enjoy how you can type in what you ate in oz. and it gives you the calorie count! Thanks for making a simple app!

title: Great app
body: The app is awesome since it's so quick and easy to log and track your daily food intake, from calories to protein per day the app tracks all of that.

title: Great app!
body: I don't normally write reviews (as clich√© as that line is) and it's actually been a few years that I have written a review for an app. However, this app is absolutely amazing and I needed to tell the developers how much I appreciate this app. I've used other apps to track calories, but this is by far superior. Thanks a bunch!

title: Registered Dietitian
body: I love this app! I have been using it myself and find it very user friendly and accurate. Kudos for developing this . I find apps where you have to look up foods and document difficult and time consuming. With this app I just speak my foods and it works. I will be recommending it to my patients.

title: Confusing app
body: I can't create a meal even though the app indicates  I can't display the food eaten by meal. When I try to change the amount say cup to tbl the change is often changed back to the original amount instead of the change. The only way to edit a meal/food is to delete and renter. I do like the way the totals are shown in label format. The keyboard should disappear when the main screen is tapped.

title: Best nutrition tracker!
body: Makes tracking what you eat super easy! After using this app for a couple days it was able to predict entries based on past behavior -- so cool! The meal planner allows my husband and I to easily share/ track our homemade meals. A must try for anyone looking for an easier way to track!

title: Extremely helpful excellent motivator
body: Might not be typical but it's keeps track of my food easily and records my workouts. Enter the food and and than do I really want the calories. This program has helped me lose 15 lbs in 14 day. Can't say enough about tracking and the intrinsic motivation it give me.

title: Great app!
body: Easy to track your calories! It'll even calculate for you how many calories you should be eating. You can look up food or scan it in with the barcode! Every day you monitor your food, exercise, and weight - then you can track it through graphs. I would recommend this app!

title: Very helpful app!!
body: This app is easy to use and really helps you track your calories right. I like how you can set you own daily caloric intake and most apps won't let you do this. Being able to scan your food makes it so much easier and takes seconds. Such a great app!!!

title: Great app still needs some minor work
body: Great app awesome micronutrients and import to AppleHealth...needs to squash some bugs when dealing with serving sizes that end in not recording item.  Vitamin database needs some work.  Would love to have a feature where it would import Fitbit food data because I was using that before find this gem of an app.  Well done keep up the great work!!!'

title: Great app! Great support! Easy to use!
body: First, I'm not a fitness app gal BUT I've been searching for an app to keep track of foods for a while. I'd download them then erase them because they were either complicated or not a good fit. Not this time! I LOVE this app. The support (hi Ashley!) is incredible as is the turn around time. Download it. You'll like it too.

title: Awesome and responsive!
body: I have been able to track easily using microphone... Bar scanner works great! Twice I have attempted to log in an ' unrecognized' item... Immediately I received an email letting me know that the item has been added into the system!!!

title: Amazingly Simple to Use
body: This app is amazingly easy to use and makes it really easy to track your daily food intake. The database contains everything I have tried to enter and the portion sizes make it even quicker to use. I love how the daily food intake is displayed as a nutrition facts panel. Works great!

title: Useful & Usable
body: Helps me log my intake quickly and easily while on the go. As a runner and a frequent traveler, Track is my go-to app to keep a record of everything I eat, including grocery goods and almost all of my favorite restaurants' menu items.

title: Great app!
body: This app is extremely easy to use. I love the summary of the macro nutrients for each day.

title: I really like how easy it is to use
body: I've tried other free food journals/calorie counters and this one beats them all. I even prefer it over myfitnesspal, which isn't so free anymore. I really like the barcode scanner to input food. Sure beats manually putting in every micronutrient. Way to go!

title: Thank you!!!!
body: I don't buy or eat a lot of processed food so I've never known how to gauge calories. I love this app- just type exactly what was in my salad and the ingredients pop up with amounts I can edit. Integrating this app with my exercise routine will help me reach my goals. Plus I get a breakdown daily of my nutrition values... love it!

title: Health Coach
body: Great app. Excellent to assist learning how to accurately count calories and the importance of portion control and role of exercise in weight loss . Some trouble adding custom foods - not intuitive. Love the scanning of barcodes for commercial foods and even restaurant food. Educational breakdown of foods into kcal, protein, fats, carbs, etc. App needs a Basal Metabolic Rate calculator to properly determine "Calorie Preference"

title: Good tracker
body: Overall, it's a good tracker. Most foods seem accurate for there nutritional values, as I compare the foods in Nutritionix with other food trackers. It would be perfect if you guys would allow it to read data from apple health, like steps and integrate the the calories burned from steps into your daily calorie intake. Also, Apple Watch would be awesome! So far great job!
response: Thank you for your feedback! We greatly appreciate it! Good news! We are currently working on adding the ability to pull data from Apple HealthKit. Stay tuned!

title: Very Good App!
body: This app is the best tracker I've used. Working on some lifestyle changes and this app responds to many needs. Whether adding your own recipes, entering in a simple list of foods, or even sharing specific foods/recipes with others with the app-generated scan codes, this app pretty much does all the functions needed to help you stay on track.

title: Super app!!!
body: Im doing a ketogenic diet so this is perfect for showing me my macro nutrition pie chart and Even though it took me a few tries to exactly figure it out the recipe maker works fantastically, plus its free, I'm a fat kid on a mission to lose the gut and get under 200 pounds for the first time in probably 11 years and this app is a tremendous help!!!

title: Really useful
body: This App focuses on tracking the dietary information of the food you eat. It does this very well, as it has a huge amount of food items catalogued with nutritional info, and it summarizes the aggregate information really well. Recommended.

title: Works for me
body: This app works great for me. I can easily add my food and know how many calories for each meal and how many I have left for the day. Had a question for Support and got a response via email within 10 minutes. Very helpful.

title: Great!
body: This app is very easy for me to use - especially the voice recognition. I also like the weight tracker.  A possible improvement would be the addition of a notes section with the daily food log. This would help me track and find patterns in identifying adverse food reactions to the food I eat.

title: Smart, simple, great
body: Great way to track food intake. You can write stuff in natural language and the app can understand it. It also includes lots of fast food menu items so whenever you are grabbing a McDonald you can track it too.

title: Great app
body: This app works great especially being free. It's not inundated the advertising and crap nobody wants to see. It has a great data base for easy meal logs. The only thing I would change is having the ability to edit exercises better. I cannot give it five stars due to that. Truly a great app none the less.

title: Awesome!
body: I love this app and I'm excited for the updates coming that I read about in some of the other reviews. One thing I would like if it was added, is a section for notes so I can write about my physical and mental state of being. Thanks!
response: We are happy to hear you are liking the app! Good news! You can add notes to specific food entries using the Notes feature on the Edit Food page. For more information on how to add notes, check out our FAQ page:

title: Compliments your health goals
body: This is by far the best app I've ever used for calorie counting. Due to it's ease of use and features that get you hooked - a feature as simple as the bar graph on the top for each day which indicates calories used and remaining. It's a healthy addiction!!

title: My fitness pal failure

body: Been using this app for about 3 weeks now, and have enjoyed it‚Äôs ease of use and clear layout.  I really like the bar code scanning feature, the copy item feature, and especially the ability to copy a whole meal, which I just discovered.  Having a large database of available foods is also very helpful.  Tracking what I eat has helped me see where my calories are coming from, helped me make smarter choices in what I eat, and helped me to cut back on serving sizes.  But there are a few requests I would like to make. 1) Adding ‚Äúadded sugar‚Äù to the nutrition summary would be nice, as this is now required on all food labels. 2) I really like the Source of Calories bar graphs (carbs, fat, protein), and the ability to set goals for these.  What would also be helpful is to see a bar graph for the percent of total fat that comes from saturated fats, and the ability to set a goal for this as well. For example, I would like my consumed saturated fats to be no more than 10% of my total consumed fat. 3) When looking for a previous meal that I would like to copy, like the leftovers from a dinner, often I have to scroll down on my iPhone to see the dinners. Not seeing it on the previous day, I have to scroll back up to the top to see the date so I can look at an earlier day.  It would be easier to look though previous days if the date at the top stayed put, and did not scroll. 4) I also like the ability to add food items that weren‚Äôt in the database, by taking photos of the item.  However, I have done this now for a couple of items more than 2 weeks ago, and still have not seen these show up in the database.  So quicker turn around on getting items added, or communicating the status of getting them added to the submitter would be nice. Adding these features would certainly make this a 5 star app for tracking nutrition.  Thank you Nutritionix.
